watches.name: Crash Skeleton Pink Gold
watches.description:
The Cartier Crash Skeleton was introduced in 2014 as a contemporary and highly limited take on the iconic Crash watch - one the brand's most sought-after classics. Limited to just 67 pieces, the sculpted case was made of platinum, housing an equally sculpted movement whose bridges were hollowed out to form the brand's signature Roman numerals. The size of the case is approximately 28.15*45.32 mm.

A pink gold Crash Skeleton, also limited to 67 pieces, was introduced in 2016.

brand.name: Cartier
brand.description:
Cartier was founded in Paris in 1847 by master jeweler Louis Francois Cartier. His son Alfred took over in 1874, but it would be the grandsons Louis, Pierre and Jacques lay the foundation for to building the brand into what it is today. The company would remain in hands of the family until 1972.

While primarily a jewelry brand, Cartier has a rich and deep history when it comes to watches. It introduced its ladies wristwatch well before the end of the 19th century, while the first men's watch was designed in 1904 at the request of famous aviator Alberto Santos-Dumont. The latter would serve as the inspiration for the 1911 Santos wristwatch, one of many icons of the Parisian brand.

caliber.description:
Shaped, skeletonized, hand-wound movement, designed to fit the 'Crash' case.

Movement dimensions: 38.5 mm x 21.2 mm, thickness: 5.06 mm.

watches.name: Ballon Blue de Cartier 42 Automatic Stainless Steel / Pink Gold / Silver / Bracelet
watches.description:
The Cartier Ballon Blue line was introduced in 2007. It features a smooth, pebble-like case. One of its signature elements is the recessed & protected crown and the 'dent' it causes in the dial.

Reference W6920095 has a stainless steel case with a pink gold crown and a silver dial. It is powered by the self-winding caliber 049 and fitted with a stainless steel / pink gold bracelet.

caliber.description: Cartier version of ETA 2892-A2. Available with or without date.

watches.name: Tank Louis Cartier Large Manual Rose Gold - Diamond / Silver / Bracelet
watches.description: The Cartier Tank Louis Cartier WJTA0021 has a rectangular case of 33.7*25.5 mm in Rose Gold. The dial is Silver. This watch is powered by a caliber 1917 MC, a hand-wound movement with a power reserve of 38 hours.

caliber.description: Cartier 1917 MC is a hand-wound movement in tonneau-shape, measuring 12.9 x 16.4mm at a height of approx. 2.9mm.

watches.name: Clé de Cartier 41 White Gold / Rivière
watches.description:
The Clé de Cartier was introduced at SIHH 2015. The case, available in a number of sizes, has a soft profile somewhere in between 'round' and 'cushion'. While at first glance the look is not unlike watches from the late sixties and early seventies, both details and finish are distinctively modern and Cartier. It's name is a reference to the clever locking system of the crown - the 'key'.

Reference HPI00937 has a white gold case set with 192 baguette-cut diamonds totaling 9.42 carats and 48 scissor-cut diamonds totalling 4.45 carats. The white gold dial is set with 224 baguette-cut diamonds totalling 6.60 carats. The white gold bracelet is set with 478 baguette-cut diamonds totalling 19.10 carats.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with central seconds and date, introduced with the 2015 Cartier Clé collection.

watches.name: Ballon Blue de Cartier 36 Automatic Yellow Gold / Silver
watches.description:
The Cartier Ballon Blue line was introduced in 2007. It features a smooth, pebble-like case. One of its signature elements is the recessed & protected crown and the 'dent' it causes in the dial.

Reference W6900356 has a yellow gold case and a silver dial. It is powered by the self-winding caliber 049 (no date) and fitted with a leather strap.
